alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 7:57AM CST until February 18 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Jacks Fork at Alley Spring affecting Shannon County. .Heavy rainfall occurring last night and today will cause the river to rise above flood stage. For the Jacks Fork River Basin...including Alley Spring, Eminence... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Jacks Fork at Alley Spring. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, water impacts Alley Spring Campground. Water is one foot in depth at the 600, 800 and 900 loop camp sites. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 3.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 9.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Friday morning at 800 AM CST.
